Name: Fragment of a wig
Description: This fragment of a statue only shows a part of a vertically striated wig and the contour of an ear lobe. The band worn on the forehead is decorated by hieroglyphs signifying the word "eternity". Given the special band and given the fact that the piece comes from the excavations of the Ramesseum, the funerary temple of Ramesses II, it could be that the fragment belonged to a statue of a queen or   goddess.
